alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:04AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, Caroline, north central Hanover, northwestern King William and northwestern Essex Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 603 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Spotsylvania to near Ladysmith to near Kings Dominion. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Bowling Green, Saint Stephens Church, Milford, Port Royal, Beulahville, Ladysmith, Newtown, Dawn, Kings Dominion, Loretto, Mangohick, Fort A.p. Hill, Chilesburg, Beazley, Golansville, Hustle, Guinea, Corbin and Gum Tree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western King William; Western King and Queen
